intro: Cyrtandra burleyana, commonly known as Burley's cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, showy flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. The plant is typically found growing in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain the seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
